I am always calm, no matter what the situation. I never raise my voice or let me emotions control me.
I have little practical experience dealing with people in the world and prefer to work alone.
I would rather make a new friend than a new enemy.
I am always figuring out how to implement better procedures to prevent mistakes.
There is no "I" in "team."
I work to live.
I live to work.

idealOptions.name: Prestige
idealOptions.description: I hope to one day rise to the top of my field and command the respect of those who work for me. (Lawful)

idealOptions.name: Superiority
idealOptions.description: Rules are meant to control the sheep.  I'm no sheep. (Chaotic)

idealOptions.name: Community
idealOptions.description: It is the duty of all people to strengthen the bonds of community and thereby improve civilization. (Light)

idealOptions.name: Greed
idealOptions.description: I will do whatever it takes to climb to the top. (Dark)

idealOptions.name: People
idealOptions.description: I'm loyal to my friends, not to any ideals, and everyone else can take a walk for all I care. (Neutral)

idealOptions.name: Faith
idealOptions.description: I trust that my leader will guide my actions, I have faith that if I work hard, things will go well. (Any)

flawOptions.description: I put too much trust in those who wield power within my employer's hierarchy.
I am inflexible in my thinking.
I like to talk at length about my office job.
I do anything I can to avoid real work.
I am not an independent thinker.  I need detailed instructions and close supervision.
I gossip about others to hide my inadequacies.

bondOptions.description: I will someday get revenge on the corrupt boss who fired me.
Everything I do is for the common people.
I will do anything to protect my employer.
No one must ever learn that I once stole from my employer.
I'm guilty of a terrible crime. I hope I can redeem myself for it.
I am committed to my group's goals over my own.

name: Outlaw
flavorText: You are a notorious free adventurer who, due to unfortunate circumstances, has lost favor with the law. However, being of the common people, they protect you due to your just nature. A protector of the people, a thorn in the side of authorities.
flavorDescription:
Though you were once just a commoner, a specific event caused you to drastically change your lifestyle and take off for a life of dangerous wandering, or perhaps revenge. Choose or randomly determine a defining event that marked you as an outlaw.

|d10|Defining Event|
|:--:|:--|
|1|I stood up to a tyrant's agents.|
|2|I stole from a corrupt Lord to help the poor.|
|3|I broke into a tyrant's castle and stole weapons to arm the people.|
|4|I failed to assassinate a tyrant.|
|5|I loved a noble, and was caught in bed with them.|
|6|I robbed a bank with unfair interest rates.|
|7|I murdered a pedophilic priest to save local children.|
|8|I received a heroic calling from a mysterious creature.|
|9|I was framed for a crime I didn't commit.|
|10|Outlaw by choice.|

flavorOptions.name: I stood up to a tyrant's agents.
I stole from a corrupt Lord to help the poor.
I broke into a tyrant's castle and stole weapons to arm the people.
I failed to assassinate a tyrant.
I loved a noble, and was caught in bed with them.
I robbed a bank with unfair interest rates.
I murdered a pedophilic priest to save local children.
I received a heroic calling from a mysterious creature.
I was framed for a crime I didn't commit.

skillProficiencies: Choose two from Acrobatics, Athletics, Insight, and Survival
equipment: A hunting trap, an iron pot, a set of traveler's clothes, and a pouch containing 150 cr
suggestedCharacteristics: An outlaw is a hero for the common people who takes pride in his humble origins and revels in disrupting authority to help those he's close to.
featureText: Since you come from the ranks of the common folk, you fit among them with ease. You can find a place to hide, rest, or recuperate among other commoners, unless you've shown yourself to be a danger to them. They will shield you from the law or anyone else searching for you, though they will not risk their lives for you.

personalityTraitOptions.description: I judge people by their actions, not their words.
If someone is in trouble, I'm always ready to lend help.
When I set my mind to something, I follow through no matter what gets in my way.
I have a strong sense of fair play and always try to find the most equitable solution to arguments.
I'm confident in my own abilities and do what I can to instill confidence in others.
Thinking is for other people. I prefer action.
I misuse long words in an attempt to sound smarter.
I get bored easily. When am I going to get on with my destiny?

idealOptions.name: Respect
idealOptions.description: People deserve to be treated with dignity and respect. (Light)

idealOptions.name: Fairness
idealOptions.description: No one should get preferential treatment before the law, and no one is above the law. (Lawful)

idealOptions.name: Freedom
idealOptions.description: Tyrants must not be allowed to oppress the people. (Chaotic)

idealOptions.name: Might
idealOptions.description: If I become strong, I can take what I want�what I deserve. (Dark)

idealOptions.name: Sincerity
idealOptions.description: There's no good in pretending to be something I'm not. (Neutral)

idealOptions.name: Destiny
idealOptions.description: Nothing and no one can steer me away from my higher calling. (Any)

flawOptions.description: The tyrant who rules my land will stop at nothing to see me killed.
I'm convinced of the significance of my destiny, and blind to my shortcomings and the risk of failure.
The people who knew me when I was young know my shameful secret, so I can never go home again.
I have a weakness for the vices of the city, especially hard drink.
Secretly, I believe that things would be better if I were a tyrant lording over the land.
I have trouble trusting in my allies.

bondOptions.description: I have a family, but I have no idea where they are. One day, I hope to see them again.
I worked the land, I love the land, and I will protect the land.
A proud noble once gave me a horrible beating, and I will take my revenge on any bully I encounter.
My tools are symbols of my past life, and I carry them so that I will never forget my roots.
I protect those who cannot protect themselves.
I wish my childhood sweetheart had come with me to pursue my destiny.

name: Pirate
flavorText: You are an experienced pirate. Banditry and raiding are common in the Outer Rim, and little negative stigma is given to pirates.  Those that prey on the Empire are sometimes even held in high regard as bold warriors. However, you still have contacts within the criminal underworld and you're far closer than most people to the world of murder, theft, and violence that pervades the underbelly of civilization, and you have survived up to this point by flouting the rules and regulations of finer society.
skillProficiencies: Choose two from Athletics, Deception, Intimidation, and Piloting
toolProficiencies: One type of gaming set, your choice of demolitions kit, security kit, or slicer's kit
equipment: One set of traveler's clothes, a gaming set you are proficient with, poorly wrought maps of Outer Rim worlds in your territory, a small piece of jewelry worth 100 cr from some exotic planet, and a pouch containing 50 cr
suggestedCharacteristics: Despite the cutthroat nature of the business, pirates come in all shapes and personalities. Some are bloodthirsty brigands who leave no survivors, others are free spirits who believe in strength over weakness. The hardened warriors of deep space can be implacable foes who often form unshakable bonds with their crewmates. The same circumstances that give them their edge can also grind them down, leaving them vulnerable to greed, shame, and the scars of fear and horror left by battle.
featureText: You've been from one end of the galaxy to the other. You know the most lucrative trade routes. You have expert knowledge of the various hyperlanes. In addition to this, you know a large number of the models and designs of common space ships that are found in the galaxy. Further, the bonds you formed with your crew are strong, and you can call on their aid even if you've been away from their side for some time. You can expect your former comrades to offer you passage aboard ship, reasonable aid, or shelter when you are in need. Keep in mind that this bond goes both ways, and they may come to you expecting the same.

personalityTraitOptions.description: I respect my captain and trust my crew. It may be all that saves my life one day.
Whether the credits comes from the split of the spoils or from a side wager, I'll get my hands on it.
When my blood gets up, my swearing could boil the icy tundra of Hoth.
I enjoy spreading the tales of my exploits, no matter who hears.
I never let witnesses escape from a raid.
I take what I need, but I don't kill without reason.
I always have an exit planned.
I assume everyone else wants to take what I have.

idealOptions.name: Equal Shares
idealOptions.description: All hands who spend sweat and blood earn their share of the credits. (Lawful)

idealOptions.name: Adventure
idealOptions.description: I'm far from home, and everything is strange and wonderful! (Chaotic)

idealOptions.name: Greater Good
idealOptions.description: I raid to weaken the Empire that threatens my people, but I don't steal from civilians.  (Light)

idealOptions.name: Strength
idealOptions.description: The weak exist to feed the strong, and I am strong. (Dark)

idealOptions.name: Crew
idealOptions.description: A ship is nothing without her crew. Protect your mates. (Neutral)

idealOptions.name: Ambition
idealOptions.description: One day I will be so much more than a captain. (Any)

flawOptions.description: I never back down from a fight.
When faced with a choice between money and my friends, I usually choose the money.
I was drunk on watch when my ship was lost to an ambush. I can't set the shame aside.
I feel I'm entitled to a greater share of the spoils, no matter the circumstances.
I won't let myself be captured. If a raid goes sour, I'm the first to run for cover.
I get lost in the thrill of the raid and can't focus on the details of a plan.

bondOptions.description: My band and I will be known across the world, and we'll never be forgotten.
My ill-gotten gains go to support my family.
Everything I do is for the good of my people.
My ship and many of her crew were lost to treachery, and I won't rest until I discover who was behind it.
My ship comes first, and all other loyalties simply pale in comparison.
A crew member of a ship we raided saved my life, and I don't know how to resolve that debt.

name: Racer
flavorText: You have a need for speed.  You live off of the adrenaline rush of piloting your craft or steering your beast through the dangers of a race.  You love the thrill of a photo-finish and relish the sweet taste of victory.
flavorDescription:
There are many places to race and many things to race with.  Maybe you dabble in all things fast.  Even still, all professional racers have a type of racing they prefer above all else; a race in which they are masters. Choose your vehicular or beastly specialty, or roll on the table below.

|d8|Specialty|
|:---:|:----------:|
|1|Air Speeders|
|2|Boonta Speeders|
|3|Pod Racers|
|4|Speeder Bikes|

|d8|Specialty|
|:---:|:----------:|
|5|Starships|
|6|Swoop Bikes|
|7|Fathiers|
|8|Varactyls|
skillProficiencies: Choose two from Animal Handling, Nature, Piloting, and Technology
toolProficiencies: One type of gaming set or mechanic's kit
equipment: A set of common clothes, a trophy or ribbon from your first-ever win, a gaming set (one of your choice), and a belt pouch containing 150 cr
suggestedCharacteristics: Racers are usually competitive and often fearless. They can lead a whirlwind of a life, and sometimes the adrenaline of the race is no longer enough for them.
featureText: You have a preternatural instinct for understanding the terrain, interpreting maps, and planning routes.  You and your party can move at three-fourths your speed over difficult terrain during long-distance travel.  Because of these skills, if you know your destination and the intervening terrain--either by reputation, by sight, or by maps you have seen--you are able to identify an effective short-cut, trimming your travel time by up to half.  Your GM may rule that your short-cut entails significant danger or may be temporarily impassable.

personalityTraitOptions.description: Win or lose.  There is no try.
Giving up is never an option for me.
I spit and laugh in the face of danger.
Why do something if there is not the possibility of death?
I am always calm, no matter what the situation. I never raise my voice or let my emotions control me.
I don't pay attention to the risks in a situation. Never tell me the odds.
The best way to get me to do something is to tell me I can't do it.
I blow up at the slightest insult.

idealOptions.name: Victory
idealOptions.description: It's not a victory if you don't follow the rules. (Lawful)

idealOptions.name: Win
idealOptions.description: A win is a win, no matter how it's done. (Chaotic)

idealOptions.name: Charity
idealOptions.description: I share my winnings with the less fortunate. (Light)

idealOptions.name: Pride
idealOptions.description: I will do whatever it takes to be recognized as the best. (Dark)

idealOptions.name: Excitement
idealOptions.description: Life is a race worth entering, because you never know how the ships will fly. (Neutral)

idealOptions.name: Victory
idealOptions.description: Nothing worth doing is ever a sure thing. (Any)

flawOptions.description: I think most people in life are content with a participation trophy. They disgust me.
I classify everyone I meet as a winner or a loser.  There's only ever one winner.
There is not a drug I won't try.
Once I start drinking, it's hard for me to stop.
Once someone questions my courage, I never back down no matter how dangerous the situation.
Waiting around makes me antsy. I'd rather do something stupid than do nothing at all.

bondOptions.description: There is nothing more important to me than my vehicle.
I will win the Coruscant Invitational one day.
I'm trying to pay off the debt on my vehicle.
I owe a lot of money to the wrong kind of people.
I do what feels good.  Let's see the authorities catch me.
Someone I loved died because they were too slow.  That will never happen to me.

name: Servant
flavorText:
You have lived much of your life in the service of a lord, noble, merchant, or someone else with much wealth or power. You fetched their coats, drove their chariots, pressed their clothes; and generally did what they asked you to do. 

Were you a highly respected butler? A simple scullery maid? Were you born into service, or did you join later? Were you close to your master or masters, or were they distant and cold? Did they treat you well, or beat you at the drop of a hat?
skillProficiencies: Choose two from Insight, Lore, Performance, and Persuasion
toolProficiencies: One of your choice
equipment: A noble symbol representing your employer, a set of artisan's implements (one of your choice), a set of nice clothes, a set of common clothes, and a belt pouch containing 100 cr
suggestedCharacteristics: A servant, for better or worse, will have their personality affected by their years of servitude.
featureText: You know how to carry yourself around the elite and their servants. When in the presence of someone of power, or the servants of such a person, you can easily act as if you belong and, barring any extremely outlandish behavior, you can pass off your companions as belonging, too.

personalityTraitOptions.description: I am compulsively neat, and clean; I feel uncomfortable if my companions and I are ever dirty or  unpresentable.
I am a bit of a snob, and look down on the common rabble.
I am extremely subservient; I rarely raise my voice or object.
I may be quite calm and polite around those of higher power than I; but I'm harsh towards all my underlings, flexing the little power I have.
I dote over my companions like a concerned mother bird, fixing their clothing and making sure they look nice.
I hated my time as a servant, and go out of my way to enjoy myself and let loose, rarely holding my tongue.
I rarely show any emotions, remaining calm and stoic even in the worst of situations.
I can-or think I can-diffuse the most tense and stressful of situations with the right word or phrase.

idealOptions.name: Service
idealOptions.description: Your wish is my desire. (Lawful)

idealOptions.name: Helpful
idealOptions.description: I just enjoy making myself useful. (Light)

idealOptions.name: Free
idealOptions.description: Noone should be bound in servitude. (Chaotic)

idealOptions.name: Infiltrate
idealOptions.description: From the position of a servant, I can worm my way into places of power! (Dark)

idealOptions.name: Payment
idealOptions.description: I don't care what my masters do; as long as I get paid. (Neutral)

idealOptions.name: Live
idealOptions.description: I only wish to serve in peace. (Any)

flawOptions.description: I become incredibly nervous around people of power and importance.
Saying that I'm a little bossy is a bit of an understatement.
I can be a sycophant, constantly fawning and flattering others; which can come off as shallow.
I've lived a relatively pampered life; the world of commoners is dull and painful to me.
I never speak for myself, letting others walk all over me.
I often can seem stiff, old fashioned and generally a stick in the mud.

bondOptions.description: I am still loyal to my old master.
The Lord I worked for is after my head, and will do anything to capture me.
My family still live as servants; I hope to earn a better life for them.
An older servant taught me the ropes and looked out for me; and I owe them a great debt.
I will exact revenge on the bastards who ruined (or ended) my Master's life.
I have plenty of friends in high places; and they've come in useful from time to time.

name: Student
flavorText:
As a child, you were inquisitive when your playmates were possessive or raucous. In your formative years, you found your way to one of the galaxy's great institutes of learning, where you were apprenticed and taught that knowledge is a more valuable treasure than gold or gems. Now you are ready to leave your home- not to abandon it, but to quest for new lore to add to its storehouse of knowledge.

The most well-known of the galaxy's fonts of knowledge is the Library of the Republic. The great library is always in need of workers and attendants, some of whom rise through the ranks to assume roles of greater responsibility and prominence. You might be one of Coruscant's own, dedicated to the curatorship of what is likely the most complete body of lore and history in all the world.
skillProficiencies: Choose two from Insight, Lore, Investigation, and Nature
equipment: A set of common clothes, a datapad and 10 data cards, a book on the subject of your current study, and a pouch containing 100 cr
suggestedCharacteristics: Cloistered scholars are defined by their extensive studies, and their characteristics reflect this life of study. Devoted to scholarly pursuits, they value knowledge highly � as a worthy goal in itself, or as a means to a desirable end.
featureText:
Though others must often endure extensive interviews and significant fees to gain access to even the most common archives in your library, you have free and easy access to the majority of the library, though it might also have repositories of lore that are too valuable, powerful, or secret to permit anyone immediate access.

You have a working knowledge of your cloister's personnel and bureaucracy, and you know how to navigate those connections with some ease.

Additionally, you are likely to gain preferential treatment at other libraries across the galaxy, as professional courtesy shown to a fellow scholar.

personalityTraitOptions.description: I use polysyllabic words that convey the impression of great erudition.
I've read every book in the world's greatest libraries�or I like to boast that I have.
I'm used to helping out those who aren't as smart as I am, and I patiently explain anything and everything to others.
There's nothing I like more than a good mystery.
I'm willing to listen to every side of an argument before I make my own judgment.
I... speak... slowly... when talking... to idiots,... which... almost... everyone... is... compared... to me.
I am horribly, horribly awkward in social situations.
I'm convinced that people are always trying to steal my secrets.

idealOptions.name: Knowledge
idealOptions.description: The path to power and self-improvement is through knowledge. (Neutral)

idealOptions.name: Beauty
idealOptions.description: What is beautiful points us beyond itself toward what is true. (Light)

idealOptions.name: Logic
idealOptions.description: Emotions must not cloud our logical thinking. (Lawful)

idealOptions.name: No Limits
idealOptions.description: Nothing should fetter the infinite possibility inherent in all existence. (Chaotic)

idealOptions.name: Power
idealOptions.description: Knowledge is the path to power and domination. (Dark)

idealOptions.name: Self-Improvement
idealOptions.description: The goal of a life of study is the betterment of oneself. (Any)

flawOptions.description: I am easily distracted by the promise of information.
Most people scream and run when they see a monster. I stop and take notes on its anatomy.
Unlocking an ancient mystery is worth the price of a civilization.
I overlook obvious solutions in favor of complicated ones.
I speak without really thinking through my words, invariably insulting others.
I can't keep a secret to save my life, or anyone else's.

bondOptions.description: It is my duty to protect my students.
I have an ancient text that holds terrible secrets that must not fall into the wrong hands.
I work to preserve a library, university, scriptorium, or monastery.
My life's work is a series of tomes related to a specific field of lore.
I've been searching my whole life for the answer to a certain question.
I sold my soul for knowledge. I hope to do great deeds and win it back.

name: Teacher
flavorText: You are an experienced teacher who knows how to best instruct others in an array of disciplines.  Although you have a vast amount of knowledge yourself, pedagogy is the most important tool in your toolbox because it allows the rest of your knowledge to spread most efficiently.
skillProficiencies: Choose two from Lore, Nature, Performance, and Technology
toolProficiencies: One instrument or set of artisan's implements of your choice
equipment: A set of common clothes, an instrument or set of tools with which you are proficient, a token from a former student, and a belt pouch containing 50 cr
suggestedCharacteristics: As a teacher you are devoted to educating others, as well as learning new information for yourself. It is up to you whether you are preachy or wise, a bookworm or more kinesthetic, a note taker or visual learner.  In any case, you are most likely underappreciated.
featureText: If you need information on something, you know if there is a book containing that information and where to find it. Further, when you hear a creature speaking or when you see language written down, you can identify exactly what language is being used even if you are not proficient in the language.  Finally, when you hear music, you know which instruments are being used in the performance, even if you are not proficient in their use.

personalityTraitOptions.description: Books are my everything.
Knowledge is the most important thing in the world.
I have quotes for every occasion.
My vocabulary is vast enough I sometimes use words that are larger than necessary.
I love working with kids.
Because I understand why people can make mistakes, I am also patient with them.
Sometimes I start explaining things at a level much to basic for the audience.
I reward hard work and good manners.

idealOptions.name: Teach
idealOptions.description: I must spread what I have learned. (Lawful)

idealOptions.name: Insatiable
idealOptions.description: When I find something new I must learn everything about it, no matter the cost. (Chaotic)

idealOptions.name: Discovery
idealOptions.description: Every single piece of information is waiting to be discovered. (Light)

idealOptions.name: Greed
idealOptions.description: Every piece of knowledge will be mine. (Dark)

idealOptions.name: People
idealOptions.description: I will teach anybody anything. (Neutral)

idealOptions.name: Power
idealOptions.description: Knowledge is power. (Any)

flawOptions.description: Someone showing bad manners does not exist to me. I will never talk to or acknowledge that person.
I overemphasize the importance of discipline.
I invest so much time into planning that I can't bring myself to deviate from the plan, even when it is needed.
I look down on uneducated adults.
I'd give up my companions for a piece of secret information.
I can't stand not reading at least one page of a book a day.

bondOptions.description: I was picked on while growing up for being a bookworm.
The world is such an open place, I feel like there is still so much to learn. I want to compile knowledge from different places.
I like reading books and writing, but I'm no poet yet. It is just a hobby I want to share with others, looking for exotic inspirations.
I will become the power behind the throne by controlling the information the throne receives.
Children are our future, and I will mold them.
I can't teach what I don't know. I will teach everything.

name: Urchin
flavorText:
You grew up on the streets alone, orphaned, and poor. You had no one to watch over you or to provide for you, so you learned to provide for yourself. You fought fiercely over food and kept a constant watch out for other desperate souls who might steal from you. You slept on rooftops and in alleyways, exposed to the elements, and endured sickness without the advantage of medicine or a place to recuperate. You've survived despite all odds, and did so through cunning, strength, speed, or some combination of each.

You begin your adventuring career with enough money to live modestly but securely for at least ten days. How did you come by that money? What allowed you to break free of your desperate circumstances and embark on a better life?
skillProficiencies: Choose two from Deception, Insight, Sleight of Hand, and Stealth
toolProficiencies: Disguise kit, security kit
equipment: A small knife, a map of the city you grew up in, a pet mouse, a token to remember your parents by, a set of common clothes, and a belt pouch containing 100 cr
suggestedCharacteristics: Urchins are shaped by lives of desperate poverty, for good and for ill. They tend to be driven either by a commitment to the people with whom they shared life on the street or by a burning desire to find a better life� and maybe get some payback on all the rich people who treated them badly.
featureText: You know the secret patterns and flows to cities and can find passages through the urban sprawl that others would miss. When you are not in combat, you (and companions you lead) can travel between any two locations in the city twice as fast as your speed would normally allow.

personalityTraitOptions.description: I hide scraps of food and trinkets away in my pockets.
I ask a lot of questions.
I like to squeeze into small places where no one else can get to me.
I sleep with my back to a wall or tree, with everything I own wrapped in a bundle in my arms.
I eat like a pig and have bad manners.
I think anyone who's nice to me is hiding Dark intent.
I don't like to bathe.
I bluntly say what other people are hinting at or hiding.

idealOptions.name: Respect
idealOptions.description: All people, rich or poor, deserve respect. (Light)

idealOptions.name: Community
idealOptions.description: We have to take care of each other, because no one else is going to do it. (Lawful)

idealOptions.name: Change
idealOptions.description: The low are lifted up, and the high and mighty are brought down. Change is the nature of things. (Chaotic)

idealOptions.name: Retribution
idealOptions.description: The rich need to be shown what life and death are like in the gutters. (Dark)

idealOptions.name: People
idealOptions.description: I help the people who help me�that's what keeps us alive. (Neutral)

idealOptions.name: Aspiration
idealOptions.description: I'm going to prove that I'm worthy of a better life. (Any)

flawOptions.description: If I'm outnumbered, I will run away from a fight.
Gold seems like a lot of money to me, and I'll do just about anything for more of it.
I will never fully trust anyone other than myself.
I'd rather kill someone in their sleep then fight fair.
It's not stealing if I need it more than someone else.
People who can't take care of themselves get what they deserve.

bondOptions.description: My town or city is my home, and I'll fight to defend it.
I sponsor an orphanage to keep others from enduring what I was forced to endure.
I owe my survival to another urchin who taught me to live on the streets.
I owe a debt I can never repay to the person who took pity on me.
I escaped my life of poverty by robbing an important person, and I'm wanted for it.
No one else should have to endure the hardships I've been through.
